class qop.tasks.Task¶

Bases: object

Abstract class for qop Tasks. Should not be instantiated directly.

static from_dict(x, validate: bool = False) → qop.tasks.Task¶

Create a Task of the appropriate subclass from a python dict

run() → None¶

Run a task

class qop.tasks.TaskQueue(path: Union[pathlib.Path, str] = 'qop.db')¶

Bases: object

A prioritzed queue for tasks

fetch(status: Union[Tuple, int, None], n: Optional[int] = None) → List¶

Print an overview of the queue

Parameters

  • n (int) – number of tasks to fetch

  • status (int, None or a tuple of int) – If not None, only fetch Tasks of given status

:return a dict containing n queued tasks

mark_done(oid: int) → None¶

Mark the operation with the _ROWID_ oid as “done” (2) :param oid: ID of the task to mark :type oid: int

mark_failed(oid: int) → None¶

Mark the operation with the _ROWID_ oid as “failed” (-1)

Parameters

oid (int) – ID of the task to mark

mark_pending(oid: int) → None¶

Mark the operation with the _ROWID_ oid as “pending” (0)

Parameters

oid (int) – ID of the task to mark

mark_running(oid: int, owner: int) → None¶

Mark the operation with the _ROWID_ oid as “running” (1). The “owner” Id is to ensure no two processes are trying to execute the same operation

Parameters

  • oid (int) – ID of the task to mark

  • owner (int) – Id of the process that is handling the operation

property n_done¶

count of completed tasks

property n_failed¶

count of completed tasks

property n_pending¶

Number of pending tasks

property n_running¶

Count of currently running tasks

property n_total¶

Count of all tasks in queue (including failed and completed)

peek() → qop.tasks.Task¶

Retrieves Task object without changing its status in the queue

pop() → qop.tasks.Task¶

Retrieves Task object and sets status of Task in database to “in progress” (1)

Raises

AlreadyUnderEvaluationError – If trying to pop a tasks that is already being processed (i.e. if a race

condition occurs if the queue is processed in parallel)

print(status: Optional[int] = None, n: Optional[int] = None) → None¶

Print an overview of the queue

Parameters

n (int) – number of tasks to preview

put(task: qop.tasks.Task, priority: Optional[int] = None) → None¶

Enqueue a task

Parameters

  • task (Task) – Task to be added to the queue

  • priority (int) – (optional) priority for executing task (tasks with lower priority will be executed earlier)

run() → None¶

Execute all pending tasks
